alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 11:01AM EDT until August 30 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN LOWNDES COUNTY, INCLUDING VALDOSTA... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN BROOKS AND LOWNDES COUNTIES... At 1101 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Central and eastern Lowndes County, including Valdosta. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Valdosta, Lake Park, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Valdosta Regional Airport, I-75 At Exit 11, Kinderlou, Clyattville, Twin Lakes, I-75 At Exit 5, Barretts, Naylor and Nankin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
